security_audit.summary: This skill validates code examples in educational content using Docker containers. All scripts perform legitimate code validation: syntax checking, runtime testing, and output verification. Network calls only occur during setup to trusted package managers (astral.sh, nodesource.com). Filesystem access is limited to user-specified chapter directories. No sensitive data collection, credential access, or suspicious patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Docker container creation with bind mount
low_findings.description:
The setup-sandbox.sh script creates a Docker container with a bind mount of the current working directory. While appropriate for validation, users should be aware their project files become accessible inside the container.

Code reference (scripts/setup-sandbox.sh:35-39):
```bash
docker run -d \
  --name "$CONTAINER_NAME" \
  --mount type=bind,src="$(pwd)",dst=/workspace \
  "$BASE_IMAGE" \
  tail -f /dev/null
```

This is standard practice for sandboxed validation but users should understand the mount behavior.

low_findings.title: Shell eval for context variable parsing
low_findings.description:
The validate.sh script uses eval to parse context variables from detect-context.sh output. While the input is controlled (local script output), eval carries inherent risk if input were compromised.

Code reference (scripts/validate.sh:126):
```bash
eval "$context_vars"
```

The context_vars are generated locally by detect-context.sh with hardcoded variable names (LAYER, LANGUAGES, TIER, DEPTH).

content.user_title: Validate Code Examples in Educational Content
content.value_statement: Manual validation of code blocks in book chapters is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically detects code languages, applies layer-appropriate validation strategies, and generates actionable error reports with fixes.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detects Python, Node.js, Rust, and Go from file patterns and keywords
Applies 4 validation depths (CRITICAL, VERIFICATION, REUSABILITY, INTEGRATION)
Extracts code blocks from markdown files and validates syntax
Tests code execution with timeout protection (10 seconds)
Generates actionable error reports with line numbers and fix suggestions
Creates persistent Docker containers for isolated validation
limitations: Not designed for production deployment testing
Node.js and Rust validators exist but are less mature than Python
Validation is read-only on source files (no modifications)
Requires Docker to be installed for container-based validation

use_cases.title: Validate Code Blocks
use_cases.description: Validate all Python code blocks in a chapter before publication to catch syntax errors early.

use_cases.title: Check Student Exercises
use_cases.description: Verify exercise code examples are correct and produce expected outputs for different learning layers.

use_cases.title: Audit Documentation
use_cases.description: Audit book chapters for code accuracy using layer-aware validation strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Chapter
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all Python code blocks in [chapter-path]. Report any syntax or runtime errors with line numbers.

prompt_templates.title: Force Layer
prompt_templates.prompt: Run validation on [chapter-path] with --layer 1 to ensure zero tolerance for errors.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Chapter
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all chapters in [directory] and generate a summary report of any errors found.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Run INTEGRATION depth validation on [chapter-path] with docker-compose setup to verify all services work together.

output: Fix: Add closing parenthesis on line 3

best_practices: Always run validation at CRITICAL depth for Layer 1 (manual typing) content
Use --verbose flag when debugging validation failures
Review the 'Why this matters' section in error reports to understand pedagogical impact
anti_patterns: Skipping validation because code 'looks correct' - always verify
Using the same validation depth for all layers - adjust based on content type
Ignoring warnings in CRITICAL mode - Layer 1 requires zero tolerance

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Python, Node.js, Rust, and Go are supported with auto-detection. Python validation is most mature.

faq.question: What validation depths are available?
faq.answer: CRITICAL (syntax + runtime + output), VERIFICATION (baseline + optimized), REUSABILITY (multi-scenario), and INTEGRATION (end-to-end).

faq.question: Does this modify my source files?
faq.answer: No. Validation is read-only. The skill extracts code blocks to temporary files for testing without modifying originals.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. Code runs in isolated Docker containers with timeout protection. Network access is limited to trusted package managers.

faq.question: Why are my validations failing?
faq.answer: Check the error report for file:line numbers. Common issues: syntax errors, undefined variables, or output mismatches.

faq.question: How is this different from pylint or eslint?
faq.answer: This tool validates whole code blocks from markdown, tests execution, and applies layer-aware depth. It is not a linter replacement.
